identificationModule.briefTitle: Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Language and Cognitive Function in Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Recovery of Language and Cognitive Function in Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of dual site-dual channel non-invasive brain stimulation for recovery of language and cognitive function in post stroke patients. Simultaneous dual site-dual channel stimulation was applied by using two sets of transcranial direct current stimulation devices. All subjects will go through four conditions of transcranial direct current stimulation with for 30 minutes. Four conditions are 1) Dual stimulation: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. 2) Single stimulation 1: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional inferior frontal cortex; 3) Single stimulation 2: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area.

armGroups.label: Dual stimulation
armGroups.description: i) anodal stimulation of ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex and cathodal stimulation of contralesional supraorbital area ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and cathodal stimulation of contralesional supraorbital area

armGroups.label: Single stimulation 1
armGroups.description: i) anodal stimulation of ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex and cathodal stimulation of contralesional inferior frontal cortex

armGroups.label: Single stimulation 2
armGroups.description: i) anodal stimulation of ipsilesional inferior frontal cortex and cathodal stimulation of contralesional supraorbital area

interventions.name: IFG stimulation
interventions.description: stimulating inferior frontal cortex with transcranial direct current stimulation for 30 minutes

interventions.name: DLPFC stimulation
interventions.description: stimulating dorsolateral prefrontal cortex with transcranial direct current stimulation for 30 minutes

interventions.name: aphasia therapy
interventions.description: aphasia therapy for 30 minutes during transcranial direct current stimulation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Korean Boston naming test
primaryOutcomes.description: measures naming ability thorough picture naming test

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Korean Western Aphasia Battery
primaryOutcomes.description: assessment of language function and provide aphasia quotients

secondaryOutcomes.description: measures selective attention and executive function
Cortical activation is measured by functional Near-Infrared-Spectroscopy (fNIRS) (NIRScout, NIRx, Germany)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in brain activation of resting-state and task functional MRI

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* left hemisphere involved stroke patients
* patients diagnoses as post stroke aphasia

Exclusion Criteria:

* history of psychiatric disease
* patients with metal implants
* history of epilepsy
* pregnancy
* skin defect at the site of electrode attachment
